11:25 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <sdumitriu> has quit  
11:31 <cjd> has quit  
11:36 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <martin77> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <martin77> Hello. If possible can anyone assist with an issue with xwiki 5.2.1 enterprise. In IE9 trying to start the wysiwyg editor on a section results in browser not responding.  
11:51 <martin77> im trying to find similar issues in jira but so far without luck. Additionally I tried turning on javascript notification errors, but that doesn't help. The browser still hangs and no notifications are shown.  
11:53 <martin77> the problem does not occur in Chrome (using v36)  
11:55 <martin77\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <martin77\_> closed my browser accidentally  
11:56 <martin77\_> if anyone replied please repeat  
11:57 <martin77> has quit  
11:57 <martin77\_> is now known as <martin77>  
11:59 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
12:05 <evalica> martin77: there is this issue http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10661 not sure if it's similar  
12:07 <evalica> martin77: please tell me if it's the same issue. You are testing with Colibri skin on a 5.2.1?  
12:09 <martin77> can you help me determine the skin  
12:09 <martin77> if thats what you're asking  
12:10 <evalica> does it look like this http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Colibri+Skin or like this http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Flamingo+Skin ? :)  
12:10 <rihbyne> has joined #xwiki  
12:11 <evalica> anyway … it's surely on Colibri since Flamingo didn't existed in 5.2.1 - sorry  
12:13 <martin77> yes it looks closely to colibri  
12:15 <evalica> martin77: it might be the issue I linked you. It's marked as a blocker, but it's listed as Flamingo only issue. Blocker issues are fixed in high priority, so it might get fixed in 6.2.x. The only problem is the community position regarding supporting IE9 (since it's an older browser). We are still discussing it. So not sure how to help you, except waiting for the fix (if indeed is the same problem described there).  
12:17 <martin77> i see, just to let you guys know that because of technical reasons with IE11 and it using a database to store cookies, we're currently unable to move to IE11 in production  
12:18 <martin77> so we're sort of caught in between :\  
12:19 <martin77> and upgrading might be ok, but I'd rather sell my manager that we can confirm this problem to be fixed in the 6.x version  
12:21 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <msmeria> has quit  
12:27 <evalica> martin77: did you reported the IE11 issue with the database?  
12:39 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
12:39 <martin77> i dont think its a gpo at this point  
12:39 <martin77> but thats for me to think about  
12:39 <martin77> im going on lunch now... checking back in 45mins.  
12:40 <martin77> is now known as <martin77\_afk>  
12:43 <evalica> martin77\_afk: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8907  
12:53 <cjd> has quit  
12:57 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:57 <rihbyne> Hello everyone.what open source projects/task are available in xwiki for new contributors.  
12:59 <evalica> hi rihbyne.  This page can be of help to you http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing  
13:10 <Denis> has quit  
13:19 <martin77\_afk> evalica: that xwiki 8907 you just closed looks like the answer to my problem  
13:19 <martin77\_afk> is now known as <martin77>  
13:19 <martin77> or rather the known issue  
13:20 <martin77> it is suggested this can be avoided by adding <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge,chrome=1">  
13:29 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:37 <lucaa> has quit  
13:38 <martin77> ah the IE9 compatibility view is Default in IE9 for opening intranet websites  
13:38 <martin77> this can be overruled with a gpo (works, tested)  
13:39 <martin77> perhaps guys, this also addresses the IE9 flamingo issue ?  
13:39 <martin77> but i cant confirm that because i dont have that xwiki version to verify my findings  
13:41 <Denis> has quit  
13:49 <msmeria1> has quit  
13:53 <evalica> martin77: it doesn't fix the flamingo IE9 thing, since on 6.2 the fix is already applied
